answers.answer: Hello,A normal menstrual cycle is a marker of female health and a normal cycle is important for getting pregnant. Women with irregular periods or no period at all may find it difficult to conceive .You need to get investigated for your irregular periods. Diabetes, thyroid disorders, previous history of STIs leading to scarring, ovulation disorders all can result in irregular menstrual cycles. Increasing age can again make it difficult to conceive. Since it is almost a year and you have not had your periods and not conceived consult an infertility expert. You will need tests to rule out above mentioned possibilities. Do keep us posted.Best of luck and regards!

question: I haven't had a period since last yearcan i still get pregnant without it
title: pregnancy
